name: fpp
description: CLI program that accepts piped input and presents files for selection

repo.name: pathpicker
repo.description: PathPicker accepts a wide range of input -- output from git commands, grep results, searches -- pretty much anything. After parsing the input, PathPicker presents you with a nice UI to select which files you're interested in. After that you can open them in your favorite editor or execute arbitrary commands.

readme.summary: Excellent clarity and examples with comprehensive installation instructions, but lacks inline configuration details and troubleshooting guidance.
readme.top_issue: Configuration options are only referenced via 'fpp --help' without any inline documentation of common settings or flags

injection_risks.description: The use of subprocess module may pose a risk if not properly validated, but in this case it's not directly used with user input.
The pickle.dump function can be vulnerable to injection attacks if the data being dumped is not properly validated, but in this case it's only used with internal data.

critical_findings: Potential for injection attacks through subprocess module or pickle.dump function if not properly validated
Lack of explicit input validation for user input from sys.stdin
security.summary: The code has some potential security risks, but overall it appears to be well-structured and secure, with no critical findings that would compromise the system.

common_complaints: Long release cycle (2+ years between 0.9.2 and 0.9.5)
Critical bugs unfixed (macOS Python segfault, infinite loop)
Stale CI/CD infrastructure and Python version support
No pre-commit hooks or code quality enforcement
sentiment.summary: The fpp project shows significant signs of abandonment with 8 open issues spanning 3+ years, no maintainer engagement, unfixed critical bugs, and a 2-year release gap causing version mismatches.

communication.summary: Maintainer responses are generally clear and helpful, showing patience with new contributors.

concerns: No commits in past 6 months despite last commit in September 2024
24 open issues with no recent activity or triage
No closed issues in past 6 months indicating lack of maintenance
No merged PRs in past 6 months suggesting no active development
Zero active contributors in the past 6 months
Unknown last release indicates stalled release cycle
maintenance.summary: This package appears abandoned with no maintenance activity for at least 6 months and accumulating unresolved issues.

governance.summary: The project lacks a succession plan and contributor ladder, posing high bus factor risk.

project_metrics.description: PathPicker accepts a wide range of input -- output from git commands, grep results, searches -- pretty much anything. After parsing the input, PathPicker presents you with a nice UI to select which files you're interested in. After that you can open them in your favorite editor or execute arbitrary commands.

analysis_summary.doc_summary: The README provides a clear overview of the package's functionality and installation instructions, but lacks detailed configuration options and troubleshooting guidance.
